technology.name: Sequence of Creation
technology.description: Performed correctly, this sequence will allow Nakai to add additional forces to his burgeoning horde, that the Wanderer's enemies may feel his might and tremble.

technology.name: Sequence of Command
technology.description: If its sacred plaque has been correctly interpreted, completion of this sequence will gift Nakai's horde with increased capacity, so larger forces may be fielded and his enemies be crushed.

effects.description: Diplomatic relations: +10 with Men, High Elves and Lizardmen

technology.name: Sequence of Strategy
technology.description: This sequence will increase the capacity of Nakai's rapidly-growing horde, meaning he can field a much larger force, making the prospect of facing this terrifying adversary all the more daunting.

technology.name: Sequence of War
technology.description: Assuming the Skink Priests' interpretation of its sacred plaque was correct, greater numbers of Lizardmen warriors will become available, so that Nakai might repel the warm-blooded interlopers.

effects.description: Diplomatic relations: +15 with Men, High Elves and Lizardmen

technology.name: Sequence of Tactics
technology.description: This sequence, concerning battle tactics, will make even more Skinks, Saurus and the myriad forms of beastly reptiles available to Nakai's horde, that he might slay the enemies of the Lizardmen utterly.

technology.name: Sequence of Military
technology.description: If correctly performed, this sequence will mean Nakai's by-now mighty horde will be able to field an even greater, deadlier force than ever before - surely his enemies will crumble in its wake?

effects.description: Diplomatic relations: +40 with Men, High Elves and Lizardmen

technology.name: Sequence of Total War
technology.description: If the Skink Priests have carried out their duties to the letter, this sequence will increase the capacity for Nakai's horde to field armies even more, so he may defeat the hated warmblood foe.

effects.description:
Nakai will aid you when defending for 60 seconds (if not in the same province) 
	(all armies)

Nakai will aid you when defending for 120 seconds (if not in the same province) 
	(all armies)

Nakai will aid you when defending for 240 seconds (if not in the same province) 
	(all armies)

technology.name: Sequence of Scaling
technology.description: According to the relevant plaque, this sequence will reduce the cost of successive spawnings of all types of Lizardmen warriors into Nakai's forces.

technology.name: Sequence of Plunder
technology.description: To the victors the spoils! This sequence guarantees that income gained from sacking and looting following a settlement battle will be increased significantly.

technology.name: Sequence of Unification
technology.description: Like all races, there are disparate factions within Lizardmen society; completion of this sequence will help them find common ground and focus on freeing Lustria from the warmblood infestation.

technology.name: Determining the Strength of the Old
technology.description: Even from their initial spawning, this sequence ensures that Nakai's new Lizardmen Lords will have improved leadership abilities from the very beginning, that they might force the warmbloods from Lustrian shores.

effects.description: [HIDDEN - do not translate] Used to increase lord rank when replacing a lord (target the effect at forces factionwide) - use in conjunction with a shown effect that targets provinces factionwide

technology.name: Blessing of the Old Ones
technology.description: The venerated Old Ones, whose Great Plan Nakai and the Lizardmen are sworn to complete, bless their children and keep them pure in the face of insidious corruption from without.

technology.name: Ancient Fortitude
technology.description: Progress in sequences crucial to the Great Plan empowers the Old Ones’ children to share their creators’ resilience against the age-old enemy.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% when fighting against Warriors of Chaos and Norsca

technology.name: Sequence of Immunity
technology.description: The jungle itself is a predator; this sequence improves the hardiness of Nakai's hordes, so fewer of their number fall on campaign when not fighting battles.

effects.description: Attrition: -40% casualties suffered from all attrition

technology.name: Sequence of Greater Infrastructure
technology.description: This sequence, if completed as per the Old Ones' coded instructions, will mean that construction is swifter and cheaper for the Nakai and his reptilian brethren.

technology.name: Sequence of Traversal
technology.description: No beings are more able to flourish and prosper within the ultra-humid jungles of Lustria than the Lizardmen; this sequence improves Nakai's ability to see danger and respond more quickly.

effects.description: Campaign line of sight: +25% for armies

technology.name: Champions of the Horde
technology.description: Progress in sequences crucial to the Great Plan sees a greater number of braves gain the Old Ones’ approbation, making them harder to kill.

effects.description: When normally killed in action, your Heroes will be wounded instead

technology.name: Determining the Unseen Threat
technology.description: Successfully completing this sequence will improve the chances of success of Nakai's Lizardmen Heroes' clandestine actions, whilst diminishing those of their foes.

technology.name: Sequence of Mass Spawning
technology.description: The steps inherent to completion of this sequence enable Nakai's hordes to spawn en masse and within a significantly shorter timeframe, enabling the Wanderer to meet growing threats head on.

effects.description: Global recruitment duration: -2 turn for all units
Favour of the Old Ones: +10 per turn

technology.name: Sequence of the Skirmisher
technology.description: As they are naturally the weaker sub-race of Lizardmen, the Skinks can be strengthened by completing this sequence correctly, increasing their worth on the battlefield exponentially.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +15% for Skink, Chameleon Skink, Chameleon Stalker and Red Crested Skink units
Missile strength: +15% for Skink, Chameleon Skink and Chameleon Stalker units

technology.name: Sequence of the Beasts
technology.description: The monstrous beasts fielded by the Lizardmen are truly terrifying; correct completion of this sequence can only make them more so - as the Old Ones surely intended.

effects.description: Missile strength: +15% for Salamander and Razordon Hunting Pack units
Charge bonus: +20 for Cold One units
Missile strength: +25% for Terradon Riders units
Weapon strength: +10% for Terradon Riders, Ripperdactyl Riders and Coatl units

technology.name: Shrill of the Old Ones
technology.description: Progress in sequences crucial to the Great Plan grants boons unto the Kroxigor, augmenting their blood-curdling roars.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% for Kroxigor and Sacred Kroxigor units
Attribute: Causes Terror for Kroxigor and Sacred Kroxigor units

technology.name: Sequence of the Greater Skinks
technology.description: This sequence improves the base-level experience of freshly-spawned Skinks, improving their usefulness on the battlefield and increasing the likelihood of victory exponentially.

effects.description: Recruitment cost: -25% for Skink and Chameleon Skinks units

technology.name: Sequence of Greater Saurus
technology.description: Even without the experiential benefits of this sequence, the Saurus warrior-class are fearsome adversaries; completing it correctly will make them even more formidable in the field.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +2 for Temple Guards units
Recruitment cost: -25% for Saurus and Temple Guards units
Bonus vs infantry: +10 for Kroxigors and Sacred Kroxigors units

technology.name: Sequence of the Warrior
technology.description: The Saurus are already near-peerless warriors; this sequence, if completed carefully and to the letter, will increases their battlefield capabilities even further.

effects.description: Charge bonus: +10 for Saurus and Temple Guards units (Rank 7 and above)

technology.name: Metamorphosis
technology.description: Progress in sequences crucial to the Great Plan sees convalescent abilities become more prevalent within the horde; tails and limbs regrow as easily as scratches heal!

effects.description: Missile resistance: 5% for Kroxigor and Sacred Kroxigor units
Casualty replenishment rate: +10% for Kroxigors and Sacred Kroxigors units

technology.name: Sequence of the Mounts
technology.description: Following these steps carefully will mean mounts recruited afterwards will be more experienced than their newly-spawned peers before a drop of blood has been spilled.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +2 for Cold One units
Recruit rank: +2 for Terradon Riders, Ripperdactyl Riders and Coatl units
Recruit rank: +2 for Cold One, Terradon Riders, Ripperdactyl Riders, Coatl, Salamander and Razordon Hunting Pack units
Recruitment cost: -25% for Cold One, Terradon Riders, Ripperdactyl Riders, Coatl, Salamander and Razordon Hunting Pack units
Recruitment cost: -50% for Kroxigor and Sacred Kroxigor units
Physical resistance: 10% for Kroxigor and Sacred Kroxigor units

technology.name: Sequence of Savagery
technology.description: The Lizardmen train the savage reptiles of the Lustrian jungles to slay their enemies in battle; completion of this sequence will ensure they are even more brutal and aggressive in the fray.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% for Feral Carnosaur and Dread Saurian units
Melee attack: +5 for Stegadon, Carnosaur, Troglodon and Dread Saurian units
Charge bonus: +20 for Feral Carnosaur and Dread Saurian units
Missile strength: +15% for Stegadon, Feral Troglodon, Ancient Salamander and Bastiladon units
Missile resistance: +10% for Bastiladon, Stegadon, Feral Troglodon, and Ancient Salamander units

technology.name: Sequence of the Guardian
technology.description: Successful completion of this sequence will ensure those who guard the Lizardmen's temples to the Old Ones are better able to repel attackers from their sacred spaces.

effects.description: Melee attack: +5 for Temple Guards units
Melee attack: +5 for Kroxigor and Sacred Kroxigor units
Armour: +10 for Kroxigor and Sacred Kroxigor units
Melee defence: +5 for Temple Guards units
Magic resistance: 10% for Saurus and Temple Guards units (Rank 7 and above)

technology.name: Sequence of the Greater Beasts
technology.description: This sequence is used to produce the larger beasts used by the Lizardmen, but at higher experience levels than an ordinary spawning would produce.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +2 for Bastiladon, Stegadon, Feral Carnosaur, Ancient Salamander and Dread Saurian units
Recruitment cost: -25% for Bastiladon, Stegadon, Feral Carnosaur, Feral Troglodon, Ancient Salamander and Dread Saurian units

technology.name: Sequence of the Old Guard
technology.description: Completion of this sequence ensures certain spawnings will be more experienced from birth and therefore require less training to be effective.

effects.description: Upkeep: -10% for Kroxigor and Sacred Kroxigor units
Recruit rank: +4 for Kroxigor and Sacred Kroxigor units
Recruit rank: +2 for Temple Guards units
Global recruitment duration: -1 turns for Kroxigor units

technology.name: Sequence of Growth
technology.description: This sequence increases the rate of growth of Nakai's horde, enabling the construction of more buildings and eventually swelling its population; soon, the warmbloods will flee afore them!

technology.name: Sequence of Healing
technology.description: When war is a constant state, losses are guaranteed - whether through attrition or casualties on the battlefield; this sequence helps Nakai to replenish their numbers for the next fight.

technology.name: Sequence of Expansion
technology.description: Completion of this sequence not only improves the growth rate of Nakai's hordes, it also keeps construction costs as low as possible, to aid their advance and free Lustria from foreign invaders.

technology.name: Sequence of Restoration
technology.description: This sequence will increase Nakai's hordes' magical reserves and help to replenish their losses due to war and attrition, that they may continue their relentless slaying of the foe in service of the Great Plan.

technology.name: Sequence of Convalescence
technology.description: Those horde-members wounded in battle against Nakai's foes will be replaced or recover from their injuries more quickly, assuming this sequence is completed correctly, of course.

technology.name: Sequence of Mending
technology.description: Nakai's horde will inevitably suffer losses over the course of a campaign; completing this sequence will aid replenishment of its numbers whilst also bolstering its rate of growth.

technology.name: Sequence of Greater Restoration
technology.description: When completed successfully, this sequence will replace Nakai's losses and reduce the cost of keeping his horde together and in peak fighting condition.

effects.description: Armour-Piercing Melee Damage: +100 for Kroxigor Ancient

ui_effects.description: Units won't regenerate if cap was reached
